speaker: ORDERLY
line: Dr. Cabrera.

speaker: DR CABRERA
line: Where is he?

speaker: ORDERLY
line: He's down in trauma. They said you'd know what's wrong with him.

speaker: DR CABRERA
line: Who transferred him from ICU?

speaker: ORDERLY
line: I did-- he was scheduled for, uh... … therapeutic plasmapheresis. They were prepping him. He went into shock.

speaker: DR CABRERA
line: What are his vitals?

speaker: ORDERLY
line: Not good. Pulse is 40. Blood pressure 80/50. His GCS is six.

speaker: DR CABRERA
line: Okay. Get on the phone to the FBI. There's an Agent Scully that should be notified.

speaker: ORDERLY
line: FBI?

speaker: DR CABRERA
line: This man is an FBI agent.

speaker: ORDERLY
line: What's wrong with him?

speaker: DR CABRERA
line: What's wrong with him is he's going to die.

speaker: DR CABRERA
line: Can you hear me? Mr. Skinner?

speaker: DR CABRERA
line: I'm not understanding. Can you speak up?

speaker: ORDERLY
line: What'd he say?

speaker: DR CABRERA
line: A name.

speaker: ORDERLY
line: He's coding on us. Clear.

speaker: ORDERLY
line: Dr. Cabrera, clear. Dr. Cabrera!

speaker: DR CABRERA
line: Let him go.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Every minute of every day we choose. Who we are. Who we forgive. Who we defend and protect. To choose a side or to walk the line. To play the middle. To straddle the fence between what is and what should be. This was the course I chose. Trying to find the delicate balance of interests that can never exist. Choosing by not choosing. Defending a center which cannot hold. So death chose for me.

speaker: TRAINER
line: Good aim! Good aim! Go easy on him, Slugger. I need him to lock up for me tonight, okay?

speaker: TRAINER
line: Don't telegraph that left, Dre. Stevie Wonder would see that one coming. You're fighting the FBI now, Dre. Fight smart. Go!

speaker: SKINNER
line: Oh! Uh!

speaker: TRAINER
line: Hey, Slugger. You okay? Slugger, can you hear me?

speaker: TRAINER
line: Talk to me. You all right? Slugger.

speaker: PERKY NURSE
line: Mr. Skinner. Mr. Skinner. Hi. You going to stick with us now?

speaker: PERKY NURSE
line: Do you remember what happened?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I was boxing. I must've gotten tagged.

speaker: PERKY NURSE
line: Yes, you did. At least you didn't get your ear bit off. That's something, right? Dr. Plant will be with you in a minute.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Yeah. Skinner. Hello.

speaker: ELECTRONIC VOICE
line: Walter... Skinner.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Who is this?

speaker: ELECTRONIC VOICE
line: Have... you heard... the news? It's... in... you.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What is this?

speaker: ELECTRONIC VOICE
line: You... have... 24 hours... to go.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What is this? What do you want?

speaker: ELECTRONIC VOICE
line: You... are... already dead. friendly older man, enters the room and rinses his hands quickly.)

speaker: DR. PLANT
line: Mr. Skinner. Didn't expect to see you up and around. You must be feeling better. Can you take a seat on that table for me, please?

speaker: DR. PLANT
line: I'm Dr. Plant. I was here with you before. You probably don't remember.

speaker: SKINNER
line: No.

speaker: DR. PLANT
line: Well, the good news is... your dilation's back to normal. Plus you still have both your ears.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I heard that one.

speaker: DR. PLANT
line: I'm going to release you. But I suggest that you rethink the boxing. You're not 20 anymore.

speaker: SKINNER
line: There's nothing wrong with me?

speaker: DR. PLANT
line: Well, you got your bell rung. Other than that, I think you're fine. Might want to ice that bruise.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What bruise?

speaker: DR. PLANT
line: Right here.

speaker: SKINNER
line: How the hell did I get that?

speaker: DR. PLANT
line: Must've taken a hard one to the ribs. But there's nothing broken. No internal bleeding. Like I said... You'll live.

speaker: SKINNER
line: At least.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What is it, Agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: I just, uh... I thought I'd poke my head in and say hey.

speaker: SKINNER
line: : Hey.

speaker: MULDER
line: What, are you sleeping one off?

speaker: SKINNER
line: No, I was having trouble seeing. It's nothing. I just didn't think I should drive.

speaker: MULDER
line: You going to be all right, sir?

speaker: MULDER
line: He's going to tell you he's all right.

speaker: SKINNER
line: That's because there's nothing wrong with me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Not that I could tell if there was. Why are all the lights out?

speaker: MULDER
line: He's having trouble with his eyes. He's also got a nasty bruise on his ribcage.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What did you do?

speaker: SKINNER
line: It's nothing.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Says who?

speaker: SKINNER
line: The doctor who released me from the hospital.

speaker: MULDER
line: That was the second opinion. The first was unsolicited. A phone call at the hospital. A scrambled voice telling him he had 24 hours to live.

speaker: SKINNER
line: That was somebody yanking my chain. Look, I got a clean bill of health.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hey, hey, hey. In the last 48 hours, did you eat or drink anything that tasted metallic or otherwise odd?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Oh, come on. Are you thinking that I'm poisoned?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did the doctor take your blood?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Yes. And it checked out.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, if you were poisoned, it could have been overlooked.

speaker: SKINNER
line: If it did, why call and tell me at the hospital?

speaker: MULDER
line: To scare you. See what you'd do. Who you'd turn to.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Oh. This is about you.

speaker: MULDER
line: Or about the X-Files.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You are so paranoid, Mulder. You're not even on the X-Files anymore.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I know. But you are. You still supervise them.

speaker: MULDER
line: What happened today? Anything out of the ordinary?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'm not going to play this game.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look, it could've been anything. It could have been the slightest touch, or a handshake.

speaker: MULDER
line: This morning, you woke up...

speaker: SKINNER
line: I woke up.

speaker: MULDER
line: Alone?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Yes. Alone.

speaker: MULDER
line: And how'd you get to the office?

speaker: SKINNER
line: The same way that I always do-- I drove.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And then what?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Then nothing-- I had meetings, I went to the gym, to the hospital, and now I'm here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Just slow down. One step at a time. How'd you get from the parking garage to your office?

speaker: SKINNER
line: The elevator.

speaker: MULDER
line: And then what?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I walked up the hallway.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I passed the same dozen people that I pass every morning. I went to my office. I said good morning to my secretary. She said good morning to me. I returned calls, I did paperwork I was here for the rest of the day.

speaker: MULDER
line: Now think. There's got to be something.

speaker: SKINNER
line: In the hallway, there was a man. He stopped me. He wanted to know the time.

speaker: (FLASHBACK
line: SKINNER gets off the elevator again, but an older man, DR KENNETH ORGEL, briefly stops him by touching his wrist with a black gloved hand.)

speaker: MULDER
line: Did he touch you?

speaker: SKINNER
line: He grabbed me. On my right wrist.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It wouldn't necessarily leave a mark. Some poisons are absorbed through the skin.

speaker: MULDER
line: What time was it?

speaker: MULDER
line: There you are.

speaker: SKINNER
line: That's him. Right there.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Wait a second. Back up. It can't be. That's Kenneth Orgel. An advisor to a Senate subcommittee on ethics and new technology.

speaker: SKINNER
line: He's a scientist?

speaker: SCULLY
line: A physicist. Very well known, as far as physicists go.

speaker: MULDER
line: He signed in here as a visitor to the office of Assistant Director Walter Skinner.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why would he be coming to see you?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'd like to ask him that myself.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir, if this man poisoned you, you should be off your feet and under a doctor's care.

speaker: SKINNER
line: If this man poisoned me I'm going to put a gun to his head, find out why and ask him how he's going to make me well.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What hospital was he at?

speaker: MULDER
line: St. Katherine's.

speaker: DR. ORGEL
line: Yes?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Dr. Orgel? Kenneth Orgel?

speaker: DR. ORGEL
line: Yes.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Do you know who I am?

speaker: DR. ORGEL
line: No.

speaker: SKINNER
line: My name's Walter Skinner. I'm an Assistant Director at the FBI.

speaker: MULDER
line: Dr. Orgel, you visited the FBI this morning. You came to see Mr. Skinner.

speaker: DR. ORGEL
line: No... uh, you must be mistaken. Sorry, you'll have to come back another time.

speaker: MULDER
line: Go around back.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What?

speaker: DR. ORGEL
line: Please, you're bothering me.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Federal agent!

speaker: SKINNER
line: Go!

speaker: MULDER
line: Drop the gun. Drop it!

speaker: TUNISIAN MAN
line: nan

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, so's your mom.

speaker: TUNISIAN MAN
line: nan

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey, give it a rest, huh?!

speaker: TUNISIAN MAN
line: nan

speaker: SKINNER
line: Let him go, Agent Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: What?

speaker: SKINNER
line: He's got diplomatic papers. It's our mistake. You can go. Just let him go.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Get in the house. The police are going to be here any moment. I don't have time to stand around and answer any questions. His name is Alexander Lazreg-- L-a-z-r-e-g. He's the cultural attache with the Tunisian mission here in D.C. See what else you can find out about him.

speaker: MULDER
line: You need to get to a hospital.

speaker: SKINNER
line: No. I'm trying to stay out of one.

speaker: DR. PLANT
line: The boxer-- FBI.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, you released him from your care earlier this evening.

speaker: DR. PLANT
line: Is he not all right?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, that's why I'm here. He may have been poisoned.

speaker: DR. PLANT
line: You're kidding. By who?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know. In fact, I'm not even sure what I'm looking for.

speaker: DR. PLANT
line: Well, you're lucky. He's on a government HMO. No one's even bothered to handle his samples yet.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is this them in here?

speaker: DR. PLANT
line: I'm not supposed to let you have those-- not without a written release from the patient.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We may not have time. He may not have time either.

speaker: DR. PLANT
line: He had absolutely no symptoms of poisoning.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are you sure these haven't been processed?

speaker: DR. PLANT
line: I'm not sure, but I doubt they've even been touched.

speaker: COP
line: I'm not so sure you should be doing that.

speaker: MULDER
line: This is a crime scene. What would you rather I be doing?

speaker: COP
line: I'm concerned for Dr. Orgel's personal property and the preservation of evidence.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'd be a lot more concerned with the preservation of Dr. Orgel. Hello, Senator...

speaker: DR. PLANT
line: It's carbon. Pure carbon. How in the world would that get into his bloodstream?

speaker: SCULLY
line: How is it working as a poison?

speaker: DR. PLANT
line: By all rights, it shouldn't be.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look at them-- just rattling around in the solution.

speaker: DR. PLANT
line: It's just bizarre. Did you see that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did you just touch something?

speaker: DR. PLANT
line: No, I didn't.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It just multiplied. Look! It just did it again.

speaker: DR. PLANT
line: Zooming in.

speaker: DR. PLANT
line: What the hell are they?

speaker: BUTLER
line: Wait here, please.

speaker: SENATOR MATHESON
line: I don't have to tell you how late it is, do I, Agent Mulder? But I suspect that wasn't even a consideration of yours.

speaker: MULDER
line: Actually, time is my only consideration, Senator. This was taken only three days ago. It's of you and Dr. Kenneth Orgel holding a Senate Resolution-S.R. 819, I think it's called. What is that?

speaker: SENATOR MATHESON
line: A funding bill. What is this all about?

speaker: MULDER
line: A friend of mine is going to die because of S.R. 819. I don't know how, I don't even know why but I'm betting you do.

speaker: SENATOR MATHESON
line: What are you talking about?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't even really know yet; all i have are a few pieces: a Tunisian diplomat, this Dr. Kenneth Orgel, this health bill, S.R. 819-- all leading up to a plot to kill an Assistant Director of the FBI. Does that make sense?

speaker: SENATOR MATHESON
line: The bill you've referred to will provide money and supplies to the World Health Organization, medical technology to third world countries. I have aided you in the past with information, Fox, and advice, which right now is to leave here at once and never again suggest to anyone my involvement in any such dark intrigue. Am I understood?

speaker: MULDER
line: This man may die; he may only have a few hours to live.

speaker: SENATOR MATHESON
line: My intention is to save lives, Fox but I can't save his. Good night, Fox. Drive safely.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Dr. Plant?

speaker: DR. PLANT
line: What? What is it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think I've found it. I think I found what the carbon's doing. It's, uh...it's not just reproducing itself. It has behavior. It's creating something, a-a matrix stimulated by blood flow in response to movement. It's multiplying and solidifying in an orderly fashion. It's building valves or-or dams in the vascular system.

speaker: DR. PLANT
line: It's building a heart attack.

speaker: NURSE
line: Dr. Plant? You're doing blood work on a Walter Skinner?

speaker: DR. PLANT
line: Yes.

speaker: NURSE
line: I just heard on the radio there's a Walter Skinner who's been picked up by paramedics at a parking garage downtown.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where are they taking him?

speaker: NURSE
line: D.C. General.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: Did you see this? We've got some sort of extreme vascular event here. How is he even still alive?

speaker: DR. CABRERA
line: We'll take the left arm first. Mark it just above the bicep. Let's get to it.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: I'll get this side.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: Hey, you... Out.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I know this man.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: I don't care. This is a sterile operating room.

speaker: DR. CABRERA
line: Get these people out.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look, I'm sorry. His name is Walter Skinner. We've been investigating his illness. What are you doing?

speaker: DR. CABRERA
line: If he's gonna live, he's gonna have to lose his arms.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, that's not going to save him. It's his blood.

speaker: DR. CABRERA
line: Who the hell is this woman?

speaker: DR. PLANT
line: She's a doctor.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're not going to solve anything until you get a scope into him. Nothing else is going to work. Look, if you want to save this man listen to what I'm saying.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's okay, sir. Lie back down. We're just moving you to another room.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Who did this to me?

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's what Mulder's trying to figure out right now. But we're going to take good care of you. I promise. We're going to do everything we can.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I don't know. I can't remember.

speaker: SKINNER'S ASSISTANT
line: Sir? Is that you? Agent Mulder!

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey, do you have the key to this drawer?

speaker: SKINNER'S ASSISTANT
line: What are you doing?

speaker: MULDER
line: AD Skinner's in the hospital. Somebody poisoned him.

speaker: SKINNER'S ASSISTANT
line: Poisoned him? Why?

speaker: MULDER
line: For doing his job.

speaker: SKINNER'S ASSISTANT
line: I-I don't understand.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm looking for anything that relates to a Senate Resolution: S.R. 819. If you want to save his life, you'll help me open this drawer.

speaker: SKINNER'S ASSISTANT
line: I don't have the key.

speaker: MULDER
line: You have a letter opener? In your desk? Something?

speaker: SKINNER'S ASSISTANT
line: Is he going to be all right?

speaker: MULDER
line: What's his condition?

speaker: SCULLY
line: He's stable, but it's not good, Mulder. He's got extreme vascular trauma and distension. His... his blood has become a weapon against his body.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, can you fight it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: We don't know what it is. I mean, the best that we can do is keep lasering his arteries open. But it's only going to be a matter of time before we lose. I mean, it's-it's building walls in his vessels faster than we can tear them down, and... and we just don't have the technology to combat it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe we do.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What is this?

speaker: MULDER
line: I found this with Skinner's morning mail. He was doing a security check on a Senate bill for violation of trade laws involving sensitive technology.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, but this is just a routine procedure, Mulder. The FBI does dozens of these a year.

speaker: MULDER
line: No. This bill was going to vote in the Senate. All it was waiting on was Skinner's review and an analysis by Dr. Kenneth Orgel.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're saying that Dr. Orgel poisoned Skinner in order to cover up his analysis?

speaker: MULDER
line: No. Orgel didn't poison anybody. Orgel came to the FBI to tell Skinner what he knew-- that there was a gross violation of export laws involving new technology.

speaker: SCULLY
line: New technology.

speaker: MULDER
line: You know what that means?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, I think I might.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's not me.

speaker: NURSE
line: You want to get this? It was in his pants pocket.

speaker: MULDER
line: Thank you. Hello.

speaker: ELECTRONIC VOICE
line: Might as well… give up.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who is it?

speaker: MULDER
line: It's a computer synth voice.

speaker: ELECTRONIC VOICE
line: You … can't…. stop it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Somebody that must know he's here.

speaker: ELECTRONIC VOICE
line: Walter Skinner... your time...

speaker: MULDER
line: Federal agent! Stop right there!

speaker: NURSE
line: Sir!

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey!

speaker: SENATOR MATHESON
line: Yes.

speaker: BEARDED MAN
line: The bill is in danger, Senator. A new threat has emerged.

speaker: SENATOR MATHESON
line: You shouldn't have called me.

speaker: BEARDED MAN
line: Blood will be on your hands.

speaker: SENATOR MATHESON
line: I don't buy your hollow threats.

speaker: BEARDED MAN
line: Well, Dr. Orgel does. You can ask him.

speaker: SENATOR MATHESON
line: What have you done with him?

speaker: BEARDED MAN
line: I can tell you where to find him.

speaker: GARAGE TECHNICIAN
line: The car is leased, part of a fleet service that services the diplomatic counsel corps.

speaker: MULDER
line: What other forensic evidence were you able to lift?

speaker: GARAGE TECHNICIAN
line: Not much on the outside. It's not surprising considering the condition of the vehicle. Inside we found a couple hairs-- human-- from an expensive wig.

speaker: MULDER
line: Don't hate me 'cause I'm beautiful. What else?

speaker: GARAGE TECHNICIAN
line: Well, we scraped the tire treads, found something odd. It's full of polychlorinated biphenyls-- PCBs. Over 500 parts per million. Now that's the kind of levels you used to see in the 1970s. Right before the EPA got fangs.

speaker: MULDER
line: From where?

speaker: GARAGE TECHNICIAN
line: Well, the PCBs are saturated evenly in the clay, uh... Demo site, maybe, or, uh, an old power plant.

speaker: DR. ORGEL
line: Who's in here? Is someone there? Oh... Senator, please, let me go.

speaker: DR. ORGEL
line: I need... water.

speaker: SENATOR MATHESON
line: Who did this to you?

speaker: DR. ORGEL
line: Hurry... please. It's... killing me.

speaker: SENATOR MATHESON
line: They believe you have exposed them to the FBI-- to Walter Skinner.

speaker: DR. ORGEL
line: No. I told the FBI nothing. I told them nothing. Please, I promise not to expose anyone.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir, there's something I'd like to try. It's a treatment called therapeutic plasmapheresis. It requires filtering all of the blood in your body. It's a radical procedure and there is a danger that your body might go into shock.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'm in your hands. I think I owe you an apology, Scully. You and Mulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I've been lying here thinking. Your quest... it should have been mine.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you mean?

speaker: SKINNER
line: If I die now, I die in vain. I have nothing to show for myself. My life...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir, you know that's not true.

speaker: SKINNER
line: It is. I can see now that... I always played it safe. I wouldn't take sides. Wouldn't let you and Mulder... pull me in.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You've been our ally more times than I can say.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Not the kind of ally that I could have been.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I remember now.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I can't see his face, he has a beard.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Try.

speaker: SKINNER
line: He was at the gym. At the hospital. He killed that man. He was at the FBI when Orgel approached me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He was following you?

speaker: SKINNER
line: The tape... he's on the surveillance tape.

speaker: SENATOR MATHESON
line: You must be surprised to see me here. I'm sure I'm not the man you're looking for.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where is he? Where's Orgel?

speaker: SENATOR MATHESON
line: Orgel is dead.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't believe you. You lied to me this morning; you're lying to me now.

speaker: SENATOR MATHESON
line: Drop this, Fox.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where is Orgel?! I need to know what he knows. A friend of mine is dying.

speaker: SENATOR MATHESON
line: I tell you, they killed him. What Orgel knows died with him.

speaker: MULDER
line: Tell me what you know, Senator. This is about S.R. 819 isn't it? What the hell did they put in Skinner?

speaker: SENATOR MATHESON
line: I'm sure you already have some idea, Fox.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's the same technology that S.R. 819 will export.

speaker: SENATOR MATHESON
line: Technology that the world believes is purely theoretical.

speaker: MULDER
line: Nanotechnology. Microscopic, atom-sized machines? Machines can be stopped.

speaker: SENATOR MATHESON
line: Your friend is already dead.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't believe that.

speaker: SENATOR MATHESON
line: If you pursue this, Fox, they will kill you.

speaker: MULDER
line: Not before I expose you and your role in this.

speaker: SENATOR MATHESON
line: My role? I am a victim here. Don't you understand that? I'm fighting for my life.

speaker: MULDER
line: I will stop this!

speaker: SENATOR MATHESON
line: It's too late, Fox. It's too late!

speaker: ORDERLY
line: All right, he's coding on us. Clear. Dr. Cabrera, clear. Dr. Cabrera?

speaker: DR. CABRERA
line: Let him go.

speaker: ORDERLY
line: Call time of death, 9:33.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir, I've spoken with your doctors and your prognosis is excellent. Whatever you are infected with appears to be dormant and your recovery is being hailed as miracle.

speaker: MULDER
line: The man who poisoned you was at the FBI that day. Scully was able to pull these off the security video tapes. Hopefully, it might jog your memory. Maybe you can identify this man.

speaker: SKINNER
line: No, I'm sorry.

speaker: MULDER
line: S.R. 819 was withdrawn by committee late last night. Without explanation.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Good. So this man failed then?

speaker: MULDER
line: If that was his true motive. If he wanted to poison you to prevent you from investigating S.R. 819, why call you to tell you that? This man worked for the government that was to receive this technology. He drove one of their cars and he killed one of his own to save you.

speaker: SKINNER
line: So you still think this is about you? About the X-Files?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes. Yes, I do. And I have an idea who may be behind all this. But I'd need your authority to continue the investigation.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I have neither the authority nor the will to allow your continued inquiry into this matter. You'll perform your duties as directed by AD Kersh and only AD Kersh.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir?

speaker: SKINNER
line: This matter's closed, Agents. Am I clear?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I've been expecting you to show up.

speaker: NO LONGER BEARDED MAN
line: You know I can push the button any time.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What do you want from me? What's this about, Krycek.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: All in good time.
